intro: Pusaetha duparquetiana, commonly known as the African violet, is a flowering plant native to tropical Africa. It belongs to the family Gesneriaceae and is characterized by its rosette-forming leaves and showy, tubular flowers. The plant typically grows in shaded, moist environments and is well adapted to humid climates. Its leaves are thick and fleshy, which helps it retain water in its native habitat. Pusaetha duparquetiana is popular as a houseplant due to its ornamental value and relatively easy care requirements.
